topic.title: Make sub-forums on that forum
topic.body: It would be perfect if here we can have different sub-forums

topic.title: How to make sub-topic in my own zero talk
TTL for everything ?
topic.body:
Feature request - TTL for user content (sites with multi signatures) or for all content. 
It would be very good if we can have TTL variable for user content, because if we have it we can optimize network for future huge data (example - topic Test messages in that forum, another one - administration - admin of site can override TTL to zero - after that content should delete from other peers)

topic.title: Thinking about search engine in zero network
Google announce Python to GO compiler
topic.body: If it is work as google say, we can compile zeronet to binary and make them faster (and bring to android/ios) https://github.com/google/grumpy

3_16AFTG7vdicwJbRQpWc2F9BRHTE5MTftE7.body:
> [nofish](#comment_334_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj):
> But the owner able to create a simple script that archives/deletes old messages.

How it is possible if content were signed with not owner sign ? 

> [nofish](#comment_334_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj):
>It would be possible, but only for whole files (after x time all of your messages will be deleted), so it's not suitable to solve the sites with many messages problem.

Why? in zero talk  /data/users/user/data.json i see
>"comment_id": 
>"body": "some text",
>"added": 1455394379

"added" looks like timestamp. Network can do self-maintaining every X days/content counts - scan json files, remove old content every node can do it itself without propagating to others.

> [gomzik](#comment_59_1F6BMqittjWUStzUbRXm2kG2GQ3RdBLqFQ): But you cant erase data from that json, because it signed by user

Yep, but if we have TTL every node can erase old content by itself
i talk about if all posts have TTL not i add TTL to them and if core support self cleanup...

4_16AFTG7vdicwJbRQpWc2F9BRHTE5MTftE7.body:
Search engine base on javascript/servers (like zero search) is bad idea for that network, i advice you look to Yacy but only to technology of yacy search. If we make search plugin for zeronet (python) it can indexes all user sites ( sites what user seeds) and broadcast index to DHT network (like yacy do) and that plugin should have zero api, so if you want to find some information in network you send request to DHT and recursively find what you want (like yacy do). 

With this architecture we have:
1) Scalable
2) Everyone can make own search engine with different features
3) Super fast search on sites that you downloaded

> [basxto](#comment_23_1PVcdu7USZH2kHMETbqDYLPjJZKCDWM52k): bad thing: you can't find new sides this way and that is sometimes the intention behind using a search engine

You can, look to yacy or twister search all of them uses DHT recursive search

> [kaffie](#comment_65_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): This won't happen. I was talking with nofish about crawling sites. He doesn't want anything that could automatically 'reveal' sites that may be intentionally hidden. So any sort of crawling, or DHT searching, or w/e is off limits. Which means a few things: 1) it won't ever be included as a python script, meaning it has to be JS, or a separate download. 2) It won't have native support, meaning that the results would be inherently limited. 3) There's still no way to grab content, making the search practically useless.
> I think the actual future of the search engines is probably going to be merger-sites, where various site indexes link out their list of sites, search engines grab and merge those, and then search through them. That way, users can select which indexes they want to search through, sites can be added by any participating peer, and it still works in the manner that's intended by ZeroNet.

If main problem - private sites that should be hidden maybe use same thing as robot.txt to block search on that sites and also if site private (how i know - we can get that feature in the future) it don't indexing at all. P2P search better than no search and also, search engine can help network growing
